product_data.description:
A modern Pinotage with lots of aroma; blackcurrant, plum and chocolate. Long finish with fine balance. Not too acidic. A super wine for the price. The wine was previously sold for DKK 199 at one of the country's largest wine merchants.
After pressing, the juice is run over the grapes 3 times to extract as much flavour as possible before being aged for 18 months.
Pierre Wahl has been awarded "Wine Maker of the Year 2016" for his work at Rijks.
product_data.name: Rijks Touch of Oak Pinotage

product_data.description:
Classic sparkling wine from Franschhoek made in the same time-consuming way as in Champagne. 75% Chardonnay and the rest Pinot Noir. Harvested overnight and chilled until the next morning to preserve the freshness of the grape. The grapes are lightly pressed and the juice fermented for 14 days before being aged for 12 months in steel tanks. Once stabilised, the wine is aged a further 27 months in bottle, where it develops its fine bubble structure.
The Chardonnay grape gives the wine elegance and fruitiness, while the Pinot Noir adds complexity and length to the flavour. Notes of breadcrumbs, citrus and fresh red apples. Incredibly fine bubbles with an almost mousse-like texture. Really delicious wine.
product_data.name: Black Elephant Vintners MCC Brut

product_data.description: A Chardonnay from the top shelf. The critics love it and with good reason. Jezebelle has a style of its own closer to European Chardonnay than classic overseas. Harvested over a whopping 7 times at different ripening times to give as complex a wine as possible. So good fatness but still structure and a nice balanced barrel flavour - lovely. Aromas of lime, vanilla and flowers with a light mineral flavour.
product_data.name: La Vierge Jezebelle Chardonnay

product_data.description: International top Pinot Noir. The wine has an aroma of flowers with a taste of red berries. Reviewers praise it for its balance and structure. This wine shows why Cathy is iconic in South Africa for its Pinot Noirs. A classy glass of Pinot Noir.
product_data.name: Catherine Marshall Pinot Noir Clay

product_data.description: The small champagne house from Ludes near Reims is today run by the 6th generation of the Monmarthe family. Monmarthe grows their own grapes, which have the classification Premier Cru. Here is a fresh available Champagne of high quality with nice bubbles and a fine aroma of sea buckthorn, red apples and brioche. The wine spends 2 years in the cellar before being developed and sent to market.
product_data.name: Monmarthe Secret de Famille Premier Cru Champagne

product_data.description:
Perhaps the world's best Pinotage! Only 20 barrels are made. The taste is strong of black and red berries. Lots of aroma and spice from 22 months in barrel. Super power with finesse.
Pierre Wahl has been named "Wine Maker of the Year" for his work at Rijks.
product_data.name: Rijks Reserve Pinotage

product_data.description: A really nice and welcoming Tuscan. Made from 100% Sangiovese from the brothers' best vineyards. Ruby red in the glass, full and round on the palate with rounded soft tannins after 12 months in French oak barrels. Beautiful structure with vanilla, cocoa and oak aromas. The palate is dominated by blackcurrant, blackberry and a little unripe cherry provide the fine balance. Goes really well with most pasta dishes, grilled pork and game.
product_data.name: Muschi Alti Le Piagge Sangiovese

product_data.description:
"Lekker" wine as they say in South Africa. A soft fresh chenin blanc with good power and fatness. Aromas of melon and apples. A wine that certainly does not disappoint.
The wine is fermented on partially natural yeast before being aged for 11 months.
Pierre Wahl has been awarded "Wine Maker of the Year 2016" for his work at Rijks.
product_data.name: Rijks Private Cellar Chenin Blanc

product_data.description: IJacques has added 3 new wines to the charming vintage: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Previously it was Pinotage. The wine is aged 18 months in oak barrels. The result is a powerful and approachable playful red. Soft plum and black cherry flavours, a little smoke and vanilla on the nose.
product_data.name: Black Elephant Vintners Three Men in a Tub with a Rubber Duck

product_data.description:
Classic spicy Pinotage from the Swartland region. Good fullness of flavour and slightly spicy. Scent of blackcurrant and a little vanilla from the barrel. The grapes are harvested early, which gives the wine a good freshness.
The wine is from Fairtrade produced.
product_data.name: Frank Pinotage

product_data.description: The ideal Christmas wine. Full-bodied, powerful and with enough acidity to cope with the fatty Christmas food. DinVinGuide selected it last year as one of the Christmas Wines of the Year. They have made a fantastic blend with the main emphasis on Pinotage (67%) and the rest Syrah. A wine that brings to mind the best Rhone wines, but at a completely different price. Lots of dark chocolate and berries on the palate with a hint of lavender on the nose. A great choice for that special occasion.
product_data.name: Rijk's Pinotage - Syrah

product_data.description:
One of the best overseas Pinot Noirs on the market! This wine is characteristic of the cold Hemel en Aarde (Walker Bay). Burgundy style; light, creamy, earthy and a little fruit. Lovely classic notes of raspberries, mushrooms and bacon.
A more selective approach to vine and field choice makes it slightly darker and tighter than previous vintages.
Can be enjoyed now or cellared for at least 8 years.
product_data.name: La Vierge Pinot Noir

product_data.description:
One of the best Semillion wines on the market, period. Grapes come from Basil Landau's field in Franschhoek which is one of the oldest vineyards in all of South Africa, planted in 1905. The wine is made with the utmost respect for these grapes. Harvested in the evening and kept in the fridge until the next day. Unusual for white wine, but in order to obtain a powerful wine, maceration/first fermentation is allowed for 24 hours with the skins before pressing. Same technique used for Orange wine. The wine then ferments naturally for 6 weeks in oak barrels before fermentation is stopped and the wine matures for 12 months in 500L oak barrels.
We give the floor to Master of Wine, Greg Sherwood "Super concentrated and broad, yet deeply sensual and textural, the wine finishes with clean white citrus, blackcurrant leaf and yellow tropical fruit candy notes. A joy to taste in a wine that really does full justice to these century-old vines from this famous vineyard in Franschhoek."
product_data.name: Black Elephant Vintners The Dark Side of the Vine SÃ©millon

product_data.description: Lovely full-bodied red wine from Fairtrade producer in Swartland. Reminiscent of a northern Rhone wine. FairTrade certified.
product_data.name: Juno Shiraz - Mourvedre - Viognier

product_data.description: Wine with great finesse. Beautiful golden colour in the glass and a lot of body. The nose is apricot, pineapple and almonds. A bit of barrel which plays nicely with the fruit and gives fatness and structure. A great wine for food.
product_data.name: Rijks Reserve Chenin Blanc

product_data.description:
Super nice balanced wine. A modern Pinotage with lots of aromas; blackcurrant, plum and chocolate. Long finish with fine balance.
After pressing, the juice is run over the grapes 3 times to extract the most flavour before aging for 22 months.
Pierre Wahl has been awarded "Wine Maker of the Year 2016" for his work at Rijks.
product_data.name: Rijks Private Cellar Pinotage

product_data.description: A superb Riesling made in the German Rheingau style. Aroma of apples with flavors of citrus and green apples with spicy undertones, light acidity and nice long finish. A really delicious glass to accompany for example prawns or sushi.
product_data.name: Catherine Marshall Riesling

product_data.description: Fabulous semi-dry premier cru Champagne. Sustainably grown at the small Champagne house in Reims.
product_data.name: Monmarthe Douceur de Bulles Demi-Sec Champagne Premier Cru
